body.p:
Com'th vs Jas E Neil
Judgment at July Term 1860

July 16 1860 for 200$ fine for Suffering Gaming on his premises. This is all you need you don't need a copy of the Judgment
Your friend Davis

Only 140$ & Its Interest is to be collected, the ballance having been Satisfied This is the endorsement that is on the execution
State of Kentucky Clark County Sct

James E Neil state that in the Year 1859, he was keeping a Tavern in Goodes Precinct in Clark County Ky, and that in the Christmas holidays of 1859 he had a party at his Tavern at which the Young folks of the neighborhood attended for Dancing & recreation. That among some of the Young men who was present, retired from the Tavern House ^at a late hour of night^ where the Festivities were being held and went into a plank Stable some 75 yards from the Tavern house and played Cards; and at which game money was won & lost ^as this affiant has since been informed^ and which occurred without the slightest knowledge of this affiant, who was engaged in waiting on the company. This affiant begs to inform His Excellency the Governor of Ky that said the fine imposed on him in the Circuit Court was respited several years since, and he now asks that the same may be finally released. That he
has long since paid the fees of the Commonwealths attorney & the costs of the prosecution Your petitioner claims to be a law abiding citizen & respectfully refers to the letter accompanying
Sworn and subscribed to before me by James E. Neil this 1 June 1864

Jas Flanagan
Ex Clark Co Ky

We cordially endorse the application of James E Neil to be released from the fine for Gaming. From our acquaintance we are free to state that Mr Neil is a true man to his country, and a man that would not wilfully violate the laws of the land.

Jas Flanagan
A. N. Bush
Sam G Stuart
Wm Stubblefield
Theodore Kohlhass

The above names are of the best citizens in the county, their recommendation entitled to great consideration. I know Neil well- The fine
is very oppressive on him. He is poor & has to struggle for a bare living & is in many respects a clever fellow & usefull to his friends & is a loyal man

The Judgement named in the petition was respited, but Executive issued for attos, Clks & Shffs fees leaving only $140 imposed, being the portion going to the State & that is now for collection in Sheriffs hands

Clark Cir Ct
vs
Jas E. Neil
Gaming
$200-
Remit
12th July/64
